units.name: How can design and innovation help to optimise chemical processes?

areasOfStudy.name: What are the current and future options for supplying energy?

topics.name: Fuel Definitions and Renewability
topics.subtitle: Fossil fuels vs biofuels
dotPoints: The definition of a fuel, including the distinction between fossil fuels (coal, natural gas, petrol) and biofuels (biogas, bioethanol, biodiesel) with reference to their renewability

topics.name: Food as Energy Source
topics.subtitle: Carbohydrates, proteins, lipids
dotPoints: Fuel sources for the body measured in kJ g⁻¹: carbohydrates, proteins and lipids (fats and oils)

topics.name: Photosynthesis
topics.subtitle: Light to chemical energy
dotPoints: Photosynthesis as the process that converts light energy into chemical energy and as a source of glucose and oxygen for respiration: 6CO₂(g) + 6H₂O(l) → C₆H₁₂O₆(aq) + 6O₂(g)

topics.name: Cellular Respiration
topics.subtitle: Glucose oxidation
dotPoints: Oxidation of glucose as the primary carbohydrate energy source, including the balanced equation for cellular respiration: C₆H₁₂O₆(aq) + 6O₂(g) → 6CO₂(g) + 6H₂O(l)

topics.name: Bioethanol Production
topics.subtitle: Fermentation and distillation
dotPoints: Production of bioethanol by the fermentation of glucose and subsequent distillation: C₆H₁₂O₆(aq) → 2C₂H₅OH(aq) + 2CO₂(g)

topics.name: Enthalpy and Energy Profiles
topics.subtitle: Exothermic vs endothermic
dotPoints: Comparison of exothermic and endothermic reactions, with reference to bond making and bond breaking, including enthalpy changes (ΔH) and energy profile diagrams

topics.name: Limiting Reactants
topics.subtitle: Excess and limiting reagents
dotPoints: Determination of limiting reactants or reagents in chemical reactions

topics.name: Combustion Reactions
topics.subtitle: Complete and incomplete
dotPoints: Combustion (complete and incomplete) reactions of fuels as exothermic reactions: writing balanced thermochemical equations

topics.name: Stoichiometry Calculations
topics.subtitle: Mass-mass, mass-volume, volume-volume
dotPoints: Calculations related to stoichiometry in combustion reactions, including mass-mass, mass-volume and volume-volume stoichiometry at SLC

topics.name: Specific Heat Capacity
topics.subtitle: q = mcΔT
dotPoints: The use of specific heat capacity of water to approximate the quantity of heat energy released during combustion

topics.name: Solution Calorimetry
topics.subtitle: Calibration and heat loss
dotPoints: Principles of solution calorimetry, including calibration factor, heat loss effects, and temperature-time graph analysis

topics.name: Energy Efficiency and Food
topics.subtitle: Efficiency calculations
dotPoints: Energy transformation efficiency during combustion; comparison and calculations of energy values of foods

topics.name: Redox Reactions
topics.subtitle: Oxidation numbers and agents
dotPoints: Redox reactions as simultaneous oxidation and reduction processes; using oxidation numbers to identify reducing and oxidising agents

topics.name: Half-Equations
topics.subtitle: Acidic and basic conditions
dotPoints: Writing balanced half-equations for oxidation and reduction reactions in acidic and basic conditions

topics.name: Primary Galvanic Cells
topics.subtitle: Design and operation
dotPoints: Design features and operating principles of primary galvanic cells converting chemical energy to electrical energy

topics.name: Electrochemical Series
topics.subtitle: Predicting reactions and voltages
dotPoints: Use and limitations of the electrochemical series in designing galvanic cells and predicting redox reactions

topics.name: Fuel Cells
topics.subtitle: Porous electrodes and efficiency
dotPoints: Design features and operating principles of fuel cells, including porous electrodes for gaseous reactants

topics.name: Faraday's Laws (Galvanic)
topics.subtitle: Current, time, and mass
dotPoints: Application of Faraday's Laws to galvanic and fuel cells to determine reactant/product quantities

topics.name: Green Chemistry in Fuel Cells
topics.subtitle: Energy efficiency and renewables
dotPoints: Innovation in fuel cell design with reference to green chemistry principles: energy efficiency and renewable feedstocks

areasOfStudy.name: How can the rate and yield of chemical reactions be optimised?

topics.name: Collision Theory
topics.subtitle: Factors affecting reaction rate
dotPoints: Factors affecting collision frequency and success: temperature, surface area, concentration, pressure, catalysts, activation energy, orientation

topics.name: Catalysts
topics.subtitle: Alternative pathways
dotPoints: Role of catalysts in increasing reaction rates via alternative pathways of lower activation energy

topics.name: Reversible Reactions
topics.subtitle: Rate vs extent
dotPoints: Distinction between reversible and irreversible reactions, and between rate and extent of reaction

topics.name: Dynamic Equilibrium
topics.subtitle: Concentration-time graphs
dotPoints: Dynamic nature of homogeneous equilibria; representation by equations and concentration-time graphs

topics.name: Equilibrium Position Changes
topics.subtitle: Temperature, concentration, pressure
dotPoints: Changes in equilibrium position when temperature, species concentration, or volume/pressure change

topics.name: Le Chatelier's Principle
topics.subtitle: Predicting equilibrium shifts
dotPoints: Application of Le Chatelier's principle to identify factors favouring reaction yield

topics.name: Equilibrium Constant (K)
topics.subtitle: Expressions and calculations
dotPoints: Calculations involving equilibrium expressions and the dependence of K on temperature

topics.name: Reaction Quotient (Q)
topics.subtitle: Q vs K
dotPoints: The reaction quotient as a measure of extent; comparing Q to K to predict reaction direction

topics.name: Rate vs Yield Optimisation
topics.subtitle: Industrial compromises
dotPoints: Conflict between optimal rate and temperature for yield; green chemistry principles of catalysis and energy efficiency

topics.name: Electrolysis Predictions
topics.subtitle: Products from electrochemical series
dotPoints: Using the electrochemical series to predict electrolysis products; writing electrode and overall equations

topics.name: Commercial Electrolytic Cells
topics.subtitle: Design and operation
dotPoints: Design features and operating principles of commercial electrolytic cells

topics.name: Rechargeable (Secondary) Cells
topics.subtitle: Discharge and recharge
dotPoints: Operating principles of rechargeable cells: galvanic (discharge) and electrolytic (recharge) modes

topics.name: Green Hydrogen Production
topics.subtitle: PEM electrolysis and artificial photosynthesis
dotPoints: Producing green hydrogen via PEM electrolysis and artificial photosynthesis

topics.name: Faraday's Laws (Electrolysis)
topics.subtitle: Current, time, and mass
dotPoints: Application of Faraday's Laws to electrolysis calculations

units.name: How are carbon-based compounds designed for purpose?

areasOfStudy.name: How are organic compounds categorised and synthesised?

topics.name: Carbon Atom Characteristics
topics.subtitle: Bonding and diversity
dotPoints: Characteristics of carbon contributing to organic compound diversity: valence electrons, bond strength, stability, unsaturation, structural isomers

topics.name: Organic Formulas and Structures
topics.subtitle: Molecular, structural, skeletal
dotPoints: Molecular, structural, semi-structural (condensed) formulas and skeletal structures of organic compounds

topics.name: IUPAC Nomenclature
topics.subtitle: Naming organic compounds
dotPoints: IUPAC systematic naming of organic compounds up to C8 with up to two functional groups

topics.name: Physical Properties
topics.subtitle: Boiling point, melting point, viscosity
dotPoints: Trends in physical properties within and between homologous series with reference to structure and bonding

topics.name: Organic Reactions and Pathways
topics.subtitle: Substitution, addition, esterification
dotPoints: Organic reactions including substitution, addition, esterification, hydrolysis, transesterification, condensation

topics.name: Yield and Atom Economy
topics.subtitle: Percentage calculations
dotPoints: Calculations of percentage yield and atom economy; advantages of high atom economy processes

topics.name: Green Chemistry in Organic Synthesis
topics.subtitle: Renewables, catalysis, safer chemicals
dotPoints: Sustainability in organic production with reference to green chemistry principles

areasOfStudy.name: How are organic compounds analysed and used?

topics.name: Qualitative Tests
topics.subtitle: C=C, -OH, -COOH tests
dotPoints: Qualitative tests for carbon-carbon double bonds, hydroxyl groups, and carboxyl groups

topics.name: Melting Point and Purity
topics.subtitle: Determining purity
dotPoints: Using melting point to determine purity of organic compounds

topics.name: Distillation Techniques
topics.subtitle: Simple and fractional
dotPoints: Simple and fractional distillation for separating and purifying organic compounds

topics.name: Iodine Number
topics.subtitle: Degree of unsaturation
dotPoints: Iodine number as a measure of degree of unsaturation in fats and oils

topics.name: Redox Titrations
topics.subtitle: Volumetric analysis
dotPoints: Redox titrations for determining concentration of organic compounds

topics.name: Mass Spectrometry
topics.subtitle: Molecular ion and fragments
dotPoints: Mass spectrometry for determining relative molecular mass and structural features

topics.name: Infrared Spectroscopy
topics.subtitle: Functional group identification
dotPoints: IR spectroscopy for identifying functional groups via characteristic absorption bands

topics.name: ¹³C-NMR Spectroscopy
topics.subtitle: Carbon environments
dotPoints: ¹³C-NMR for determining number and type of carbon environments

topics.name: ¹H-NMR Spectroscopy
topics.subtitle: Proton environments, integration, splitting
dotPoints: ¹H-NMR for proton environments, integration ratios, and n+1 splitting rule

topics.name: High-Performance Liquid Chromatography
topics.subtitle: Retention times and calibration
dotPoints: HPLC for separation, identification, and quantification of organic compounds

topics.name: Combined Spectroscopic Analysis
topics.subtitle: Deducing structure
dotPoints: Using combined MS, IR, and NMR data to deduce organic compound structures

topics.name: Medicines from Nature
topics.subtitle: Extraction and purification
dotPoints: Extraction and purification of organic compounds from natural sources

topics.name: Functional Groups in Medicines
topics.subtitle: Structure-activity relationships
dotPoints: Role of functional groups in the activity of medicines

topics.name: Chirality in Pharmacology
topics.subtitle: Enantiomers and drug activity
dotPoints: Chirality and isomers in determining medicine effectiveness

topics.name: Enzyme Structure and Function
topics.subtitle: Primary to quaternary structure
dotPoints: Enzyme structure from primary to quaternary; temperature and pH effects

topics.name: Enzyme Inhibitors
topics.subtitle: Competitive inhibition
dotPoints: Competitive enzyme inhibitors and the lock-and-key mechanism
